reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I had 3 nites at this fabulous little hotel. Staff very friendly, the room was lovely, quaint and comfy. Breakfast is unbelievably good with great selection and even had soy milk for my cereal.
reviews.title: Fantastic little hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location just near the subway. Would highly recommend.
reviews.title: Great stay at Room Mate Mario.

likes.liked: — refreshing modern decor. clean. spacious. great bathroom.
likes.disliked: — would like to have had a hotel computer available for internet access. otherwise, no complaints.

reviews.title: Really goood hotel
reviews.text: Brisbane, Australia

reviews.title: Great little hotel
reviews.text: Room Mate Mario is a stones throw from the Royal Palace in Madrid and a great location for the major sites of this charming city. The staff was friendly, rooms clean and refreshing with their modern decor. Buffet breakfast was included with my reservation and was very good. Excellent value in Madrid. This small chain of hotels in Spain does an excellent job. Wish they were in other countries.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: We had a great time. The hotel is in an excellent location, the staff were laid back but efficient, and the overall quality of the accomodation was excellent. We shall definitely return
reviews.title: Mario is spot on! Brilliant!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed here with a group of friends last year. It's very trendy, in style and decor and the staff were friendly and helpful. The location is excellent and it's easy to walk to all the sights, city centre, bars and restaurants.
reviews.title: great location
Great location friendly little hotel
reviews.text: The buffet continental breakfast was above average. Our room was on the front street and was noisy late at night due to a disco next door. I'd recommend rooms overlooking the back.

reviews.title: Great Place in Madrid
reviews.text: We just stayed at Room Mate Mario for 3 nights. The hotel location is great. It is right off the metro Opera station and is within walking distance to Plaza de Mayor and Palacio Real. We took the metro from the airport. Even we needed to change 3 metro lines the journey was not bad. The hotel is right up the small alley next to Burger King.

reviews.title: Hotel Mario - Madrid, Spain
reviews.text: The front desk staff were very friendly and helpful. The room is small but adequate and clean. This is a great value hotel.

reviews.title: Very enjoyable, relaxed stay
reviews.text: My first experience of booking a hotel from reports on Trip Advisor and I must say how delighted my wife and I were.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Good location, well designed, reasonable price...and free wi-fi internet.
reviews.title: well designed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic hotel - great location, clean funky and a little bit different. Def. reccommend
reviews.title: Fantastic

likes.disliked: — Dog Portraits, poor fallatio, Frequency of Spaniards

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: I stayed at the Mario for two nights - I was suprised by the central location which was fantastic - really central to the shops and literally a stones throw from the Royal palace.... The hotel room, staff and breakfast were all an absolute pleasure - nothing too much trouble and I most certainly look forward to my next stay :) THANKYOU!!!!!!!!
reviews.title: Perfect - Location, Staff, Everything !!!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: Friendly staff, great location, very clean, excellent breakfast options, plenty of pillows, and good amenities (wireless internet, fresh fruit, etc).
reviews.title: Decent hotel, convenient location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: 2 downsides (but would not necessarily prevent me from staying in the future)
reviews.title: Great value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Mario for one night only (the next day we went to Toledo and, when we came back to Madrid, stayed at another Roommate hotel, the "Laura").
reviews.title: Very good value for money!

likes.liked: — The staff, which was very helpfull
likes.disliked: — The shower - it didn't have curtains or glass, so it messed up the whole bathroom.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is very well located, the decoration is fantastic, the room they gave us was huge (bathroom wasn't, tho, but wasn't bad). Breakfast was very nice, and above all, the staff was great, extremelly helpful and simpathethic. I will definitelly stay there again if I'm back in Madrid.
reviews.title: GREAT HOTEL

likes.disliked: — The lady works in the breakfast room

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2006
reviews.text: One of the best hotels and the location was ideal. The room was small but who cares. It was clean and functional.
reviews.title: good value, bright and modern design, excellent staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Since the hotel is 2 minutes walk from the Opera metro station, taking the metro from the airport to the hotel eventhough a little bit inconvenience, is doable and cheap. As you get out of the metro, look for the Burger King (I think, if it wasn't Burger King, it's one of American burger restaurants), the hotel is toward that direction. If you're sure not which metro line to take, as you arrive at the airport, check with the people in the information office. Tell them you want to get to Opera stop, they will give you direction and a metro map.
reviews.title: Great small boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Booked directly last minute. Very helpful staff, some of the best I encountered during my 2 week trip to Spain. Rooms are small but smartly designed. They had free internet access and a large breakfast was included. It was in a nice location, stones throw from the Opera and subway stop.
reviews.title: Funky Hotel, Great Location

likes.disliked: — A bit on the noisy side

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We were staying att Room Mate in october 2008 and thougt it was a really great hotel for the price. It is very central behind the Opera whitin 200 m from the royal palace and in walking distance too all major sightseeing places in Madrid.
reviews.title: clean and central

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is in a quite strees with very little noice.
reviews.title: Good hotel in good location
Mario - very convenient!
reviews.text: Clean, nice personal and a fine breakfast for the price.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not luxurary in any way but well worth the money.
reviews.title: Fab hotel, loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: We stayed in the Room Mate Mario for four nights at the end of October 2008. Having stayed there once before and been impressed, booked again for another stay.
reviews.title: Impressed with Room Mate Mario!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mario is nicely located within a couple blocks of the Royal Palace and a 5 minute walk to Plaza Mayor and Puerta de Sol. The Room Mate hotel chain seems to be opening new properties which were booked at the time we planned our trip. Mario was one of the only properties left as we would have liked a newer property such as Oscar. Our room was clean and nicely sized facing the street with a small balcony.
reviews.title: Mario Did the Job

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008
reviews.text: Noise was not an issue for us as the windows did a great job of blocking out sound. We were only a couple floors off the street and didn't hear a peep. The hotel isn't on a main street, so it was relatively quiet anyway.
reviews.title: Noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel delivered what was expected, but showed signs of wear and tear.
reviews.title: Great location, great hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Breakfast was included in the rate and was a nice selection of fruits, breads, meats, cheeses, tortillas (spanish egg and potato omelette), and cereals.
reviews.title: Very good value

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The staff was very friendly and helpful and spoke great English. Free online access in the lobby helped us build our game plan for our nights out in the city.
reviews.title: loved mario

likes.disliked: — Although in a nice neighborhood, no views (you look out onto the back of other buildings)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Fantastic location in a wonderful city. Hotel was full of character delightfully Spanish without the glitz of the Costa's.Whenever a request was made to the staff they were incredibly helpful and there local knowledge was invaluable. If you stay in Granada go to the restaurant - La Huerto Juan Ranas just below the Playa St Nicholas. Loveley food with the best view I have I ever had.
reviews.title: Migueletes Granada- Fantastic

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I enjoyed very much staying at Hotel Room Mate Mario. The room was simple but nice and clean. The location is wonderful, just near Opera and Plaza del Sol. The breakfast was wonderful. The staff is kind.
reviews.title: Nice choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Property was great, staff was great. Checked in at late hour and everything was handled very smoothly. Room was soothing despite being very modern in its decor. Only wish breakfast was served a bit earlier (in most other cities on my trip it started at 6 or 6:30 am) -- but nothing else seems to be open in Madrid at an early hour, so that probably can't be helped. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Very unique.

likes.liked: — Everything except for starting time of breakfast

reviews.title: Mario Average
reviews.text: I stayed at the Room Mate Mario for 7 nights, as I was in Madrid for a conference. The room was clean, the service was reasonably pleasant. The location (near the Opera Metro) is excellent. The English of some of the staff was not very good and made things difficult at times. The breakfast was fine, but after day 2 was tiresome as it was exactly the same thing each day. The wireless internet went down for the last two days of my stay - that was a HUGE problem as I required it for my work - but the staff didn't seem bothered by this and it still was not working by the time my stay was over.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was excellent. I am unable to find even a small negative. From the minute you walk in to the foyer with its funky black and red decor and fabulously friendly staff you feel at home. Each floor is decorated in a different colour scheme - ours was red. There were funky red lights everywhere and our room was painted in a groovy red design. The room was extremely comfortable and the breakfast was fabulous. The breakfast room was just as funky as the rest of the hotel! The location of the hotel was excellent. I would recommend staying at this hotel without reservation. We spent a month in Europe and this was by far the best hotel we had the pleasure to stay in.
reviews.title: Fabulous!

likes.disliked: — There were no negatives to this hotel

reviews.title: Every Big City needs this hotel
reviews.text: We totally enjoyed our stay at the Mario. The location was perfect, near everything we wanted to see in Madrid, shoping and restaurants. It was less noisy than the hotels we had stayed in

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Granada and Sevilla which were located in the middle of the cities. The breakfast was great, served from 8a-12n. The rooms were clean and everything worked. The people were very helpful. The only thing I noticed amiss were some light bulbs burned out in the red lobby chandalier. Somehow I can't get very upset about that when everything else was so perfect, right down to the apple free by my bed. The price was right.
reviews.title: Close but no cigar

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Thanks, Mario.
reviews.title: Great experience, fabulous staff!

likes.liked: — the general look / feel of the hotel, and the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ann
reviews.title: Liked the Mario

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's a really cute concept, but it kind of fails upon execution...
reviews.title: The best place, friendly, clean and central to everything. Must stay hotel

likes.liked: — Clean, central, friendly, accomodating, great breakfasts, opposite great tapas bar - Chic
likes.disliked: — There was nothing that I did not like about this accomodation

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location, near the Opera metro stop and within walking distance of Plaza Mayor, Plaza del Sol, and the great Tapas bars in the old section. The staff speak fluent English and were VERY helpful in finding us great places to eat and things to do. The breakfast is quite good (buffet style) and open until noon (which you'll need given the lateness of most Spanish dinners.
reviews.title: Great Staff, Noisy Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The downside was that the windows block little sound from the street and the hall has bare floors and walls, so every sound is magnified. Bring earplugs and your own alarm clock. Queen size beds are actually two singles pushed together.
reviews.title: Highly recommend

likes.liked: — friendly & helpful staff, hip design style, breakfast, convenience location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled solo
reviews.text: Spent 4 nights in early October, like the atmosphere right away. Trendy designed lobby & guest rooms, spacous room, (we have 2 huge luggages & we were able to walk around when we layed them both open on the floor), fluently English speaking, friendly & helpful staff, free internet at the lobby, attractive breakfast (it's really GOOD!). Powerful shower (I see that very important!) And there's no way you can complain the location, Grand Via, C/ Mayor are 8 minutes walk, metro 1 minute away, yet a quiet inner street spot.
reviews.title: Handy but noisy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled with family
reviews.text: The only down thing I had was I stayed at the very last room on the 1/F., which is right next to the kitchen, it's really noisy when they prepare BF in the morning (from 7am...) See if you can request a room on the 2/F.
reviews.title: Super Mario

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having stayed there for one night last week, I was surpirsed that no mention has been made of the noise in other reviews.
reviews.title: Yes, it's good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Room Mate Hotel Mario is simply great! Perfect location in the heart of Madrid and just a few step from Opera underground station. Staff was always really kind and helpful (my sincere compliments). They gave me room 222 which was a large and really confortable room. Good point for the spacious walk-in shower!!! A rich buffet breakfast (that you can have until noon) is included in the rate. If you come to Madrid you should definetly visit this hotel considering also the fact that you pay just 100/150 euro per night.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel, Great Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Ciara and I have just spent five days in Madrid, staying at the Room Mate Mario Hotel. It is normal for us to spend some time researching hotels online befor we book, ( we are very fussy )and never stay at anything less than four star.Something kept bringing me back to this group of Hotels though. What a find! We have nothing but praise for the Mario. The location could not be better, on a quite street two minutes walk from the Opera Metro. Transfair from the airport by Metro was quick, clean, and cost one euro. You can walk to all the main attractions easily, or take the Metro if you wish. The desk staff were genuinely friendly,helpfull, and had a great sence of hummour. They advised of places to go,booked restauraunts, and went out of their way to make our stay pleasureable.The Hotel is arty,boutique modern the rooms are fantastic, spotlessly clean, big beds, and great power showers. Unlike other Hotels breakfast is included in the price and they dont make you get up early in the morning either. We had brunch most days and did'nt need to eat untill dinner. I have never felt the need to write a review before but someone is doing something right here and should be complemented on it.
reviews.title: Just the best Hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Everything was perfect, except the air condition, which aimed to the bed, so we could not use it during the night. We had to open the window, but the internal yard was noisy so sometimes it was difficult to sleep.
reviews.title: Hotel Mario which I recommend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Basic hotel with just reception and breakfast room in the public areas. That said, room was clean and well maintained and bathrooms very good (we had two rooms as a family). Breakfast a highlight as ever with this chain - excellent continental and thrown in with the very reasonable price. Location very central - a couple of minutes from Palacio Real and main shopping area but not at all noisy as down a side street. Staff all spoke good English and were very friendly and competent. In value for money terms 10 out of 10. We would recommend this place and indeed this chain and will stay with them again.
reviews.title: Basic but good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008
reviews.text: For the last few years I've used this web site before booking a holiday and have always found it more that usfull but this time we really seem to have been unlucky. Having said that we really enjoyed our time in Madrid which is an excellent city.
reviews.title: We must have been unlucky

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very nice hotel in a great location. Rooms are nice. Very modern design. People in the hotel were very nice and helpfull. Breakfast was very good and there was allways prenty of everything.
reviews.title: Great location, staff, room and breakfast

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great place to stay. Great location. Staff are very friendly with great advice. Hotel was super clean, modern and stylish. The included breakfast was also excellent. I have recommended it to all my friends.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
Nice hotel, reasonable price, funky decor!
reviews.text: I spent 2 nights here in October. I've stayed in Madrid a few times before and this is the best hotel so far regarding location relative to price/standard of accomodation (I've paid more for inferior accomodation).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: The hotel decor is interesting - a kind of groovy, funkadelic, 60's/70's style, man! But don't let that put you off. Navigating your way around the corridors was also a bit confusing. The room was large, clean and comfortable with good facilities, but I believe all the rooms vary somewhat in size & layout.
reviews.title: Highly recommended

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I found the staff very helpful, and the receptionist spent time choosing & discussing the best room for me when I arrived. I ended up with a room looking out into the central courtyard, but she said this was one of the better rooms.
reviews.title: Great location, great value, great service, awsome breakfast

likes.disliked: — shower door letting too much water go on the bathroom floor

reviews.title: Really enjoyed our stay at the mario
reviews.text: We really enjoyed our stay at the room mate Mario, nice little hotel, very clean, very trendy, we stayed in room 118 which was on the outside of the building, nice size room larger than the one we had stayed in london. The reception asked us if noise would bother us from the street, we said no, not a great deal of noise in February, and walking round madrid all day once our heads hit the pillow we were out like a light. The room was right next to the breakfast room where there was a bit of noise, but it didn't bother us, we could still doze off, and anyway we needed to be up and out, we didn't go to madrid to lie in bed late. Lovely breakfast, the museli was good and toast and juice plus coffee, good selection of meats and cheese if you like that sort of thing, very clean.

reviews.title: Great small hotel
reviews.text: Great for the tube and just round the back 5 mins walk away was the royal palace. Great location.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was a great choice. We picked it for location, which is perfect. Close to everything in the city center. Neat neighborhood. Not even 1 block from the Opera Metro station. The hotel is just as pictured on the net. Nice rooms, clean; good beds. The staff has been friendly, helpful, considerate, speaking adequate english. They have gone out of their way to be helpful. They also have a free computer for internet access in the lobby - very convenient. Strongly recommend.
reviews.title: Great location, but noisy
Marvellous Mario
reviews.text: I stayed in this hotel for three nights at the start of January. The location is very, very good and I would stay there again because of this. However it is not the perfect hotel. It has very contemporary decor which makes a pleasant change. However, all the trendy timber and steel makes for a noisy place, especially at night when every sound echoes. A woman walking past your room wearing high heels sound like a 21-gun salute. the noise of voices also travels, as do the rumblings of the lift. Also, there is no bar which is a pity as it's nice at night to have someplace to come back to for a nightcap. There is some tricky photography in their web-site, and what looks like a bar is in fact the reception desk!! The breakfast each morning is very nice and the staff are helpful. They have an amazingly low rate to use the bedroom phone. I had to make an emergency phonecall from the room to a mobile in Ireland. This 4 minute call cost me 45cent!!! I asked for this to be checked but was told that this was their rate.....wow! It's a nice place, safe location as well as terribly central. When you exit the metro at Opera, just look for the bright lights of Burger King and it's just a few doors up that side street. It;s spotlessly clean too.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2006, traveled with family
reviews.title: Modern hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is PERFECT!its close to everything..restaurants,theatres,the metro etc..The buffet breakfast was good and the staff were really friendly and helpful. I arrived at the hotel at around 9pm and the staff already knew I was coming and everything was ready. I asked to change rooms TWICE and they were very accommodating about it(no extra charges for a bigger room!) I suggest to any couples who are planning to stay in this hotel to get an executive room instead of the standard ones, and ask for a room facing the streets as you'll have two large windows and more sunlight. It was quite noisy during the last two nights though(sounded like someone was dragging and banging their bags on the roadside) but other than that, everything was perfect! I highly recommend the room-mate chain of hotels for their excellent value for money and service.
reviews.title: Funky Room-Mate

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: hotel looked great on the pictures and we were not disappointed.
reviews.title: excellent decor!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: staff were extremely friendly and helpful.We arrived on the day of the Champions League final and they asked around and checked on the internet to find out which TV channels and therefore pubs were showing the game.
reviews.title: Fantastic!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Buffet breakfast was one of the best i have ever had and included in the room rate.
reviews.title: wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008
reviews.text: Good location, very close to metro stop and about 10 minute walk from Sol.
reviews.title: Wonderful in every way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: Stayed here for two nights while in Madrid to see Bruce Springsteen. The hotel is nice enough. Its quite contemporary which I like. It does feel slightly "cheap" but it is very good value. Some of the fittings in the room could be better quality but for the price its very good
reviews.title: Nice Hotel

likes.disliked: — Thin curtains, and a slightly confusing layout. Getting lost in the Hotel is easy !

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Location is great, up a quiet street off the Teatro Real. No noise at night at all. Very friendly staff, and a lovely breakfast made it a fine base to see Madrid. Didnt like the very thin curtains, which were also white. It was ok in gloomy November, but can imagine they are pretty useless in summer.
reviews.title: Thumbs Up.....But

likes.disliked: — small room, lack of soft lighting, sterile decor, uncomfortable mattress

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: We booked this hotel based on the Tripadvisor reviews. Basically the reviews were pretty much on target but there were some caveats. First the good news: the hotel is marvelously located within walking distance of the Metro as well as many important sites and next door to a really lively and wonderful restaurant. The staff is universally superb, willing to help with any questions, totally unpretentious, down to earth and always ready to go the extra distance, answer questions and provide assistance. We were not particularly needy but when we needed them they were always there for us. The breakfasts are wonderful......the best croissants we've ever tasted in many years of travel and lots of other goodies as well. To call this a continental breakfast is an injustice. It's a delightful spread, albeit all cold, and everything is fresh, appetizing and delicious. The free hookup for the laptop is also a very nice plus and it was very fast and easy to get going.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the bad news: our room, facing a courtyard, was considered to be one of the larger rooms. I just cannot imagine the smaller rooms. We constantly were banging our feet onto the plastic chair at the computer table since there was just no place to walk around it. The room was just too small. The mattress was very hard and uncomfortable and it was hard to get the lights dim enough to read before drifting off to sleep. The room was too well lit with no soft lights near the bed. There was also a step from the bathroom into the bedroom which we were concerned about. An easy way to break an ankle and a real danger. They were not very generous with the daily refills of amenities. We got one laundry bag which was not nearly anough for a 6 night stay. No matter how minute a piece of soap we left, it would be there for us when we returned in the evening. Supplies seemed to be rationed out very parsimoniously. And we were told to recycle our towels if possible but this was never possible since the towels were always needed to mop up from the shower which was not enclosed (although ours was in the bathroom and not in the room as others have reported). And, despite the descriptions of designer decor, our room was very sterile looking, without any charm, almost like a hospital room, functional but not attractive or welcoming.
reviews.title: Room-Mate Mario (Madrid) was worth it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled on business
reviews.text: All in all, the Mario had pluses and minuses but it is far from dirt cheap. It cost us almost $1,000. for a 6 night stay in November, not the busiest time of year. Perhaps we could have done better.
reviews.title: Nice location, better for holidays than for business

likes.disliked: — furniture looks run down and cleanline

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very good hotel, with nice and modern style. Perfect service, very good breakfast.
reviews.title: Everything is perfect

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Excellent location and staff and the breakfasts were superb. This was my third visit and I would not hesitate to book this hotel again.
reviews.title: Superb Mario

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: An excellent find (through TripAdvisor originally). The Room Mate concept is of a design hotel, with all the services I require, for a very attractive price.
reviews.title: Excellent budget-boutique hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and functional, with minimalist design. The lobby and the corridors are attractively decorated. The breakfast was plentiful and varied. Free wi-fi is always good, and there was a terminal available for guests without laptops or whatever device of their own.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Mario hotel is right in the centre, very convenient for pretty much anything.
reviews.title: Great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: The location was perfect. Walking distance to shoppingstreets, cafees and attractions. The room was a bit small - the twin beds more like a doublebed but OK. The breakfast was top.
reviews.title: Excellent location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Liked the modern style of this cityhotel.
reviews.title: Loved the Mario in Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Can highly recommend the restaurant just across the street for lunch. Very friendly waitors and the food was good - also reasonable prices.
reviews.title: Great Madrid stay

likes.liked: — The design of the hotel, the cleanliness and the friendly staff.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled on business
reviews.text: Recommend the Madrid city bus-tour. Stop near the hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at Mario

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Just returned from a 4 night stay at the Hotel Mate Mario. For the price we paid (£268.00) excellent value for money.
reviews.title: Great Hotel, Ideal position in Granada, What Else ? ;-)

likes.disliked: — Maybe the bed but I like it very hard

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with family
reviews.text: Only 2 nights in Granada so we needed great location and service. This place was perfect for both. Location meant easy walking to all the highlights. Plus they saved us time and trouble by booking for us...tickets to Alhambra, Flamenco, even our bus to Nerja. Fabulous breakfast. We has 3 in the room and were not crowded.
reviews.title: Great place for our short stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly staff. Very good location. Excellent breakfast! Will stay there again!!
reviews.title: Absolutely fab!

likes.disliked: — The room looked out on a light well with a wall opposite the window. Was out most of the time though so did not mind!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: I found out about this hotel on the Vueling website and then I checked with www.fodors.com. This is a great website because you get comments on hotels/restaurants from travelers all over the world.
reviews.title: Wonderful experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mate Mario is a very good quiet hotel with an excellent location, just a few minutes from the Royal Palace and other famous attractions. Good breakfast and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Mucho mas que Mario!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I recommend it!
reviews.title: Perfect for a visit to Madrid

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled solo
reviews.text: Very nice hotel in the centre of town. Closed to a lot of sight seeing. Staff is very friendly. Breakfast included and very good for spanish relations. A lot of restaurants nearby. Metro very close. Room was very clean. I loved the design of the hotel. Rooms are small but ok for a city trip. Corridor could be noisy. Had a room to the back, therefore it was quite. Would go there again.
reviews.title: Loved it!

likes.liked: — Very central - Wireless included - breakfast - friendliness of staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Stayed at the Room Mate Mario for my Hen Do. It was the most perfect choice. The hotel is modern and very clean. Staff were extremely helpful and let us keep the room longer so we could change before going to the airport. The breakfast is amazing, it is served until 12 and there is loads of choice. The location is minutes from Puerto Del Sol and Plaza Mayor and yet quiet enough to get some sleep. I could not have asked for better. Will definately stay at this hotel again.
reviews.title: Fabulous Hotel

likes.disliked: — Could not find my way around it

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed for 3 nights on a room facing the street. Luckily the hotel was on a quiet side street, because any shouting or loud vehicles passing by was quite audible inside the room. The room was very basic, but clean with a comfortable bed. The air-conditioning worked great. I thought that the free breakfast buffet had enough variety and was plentiful. The hotel had one computer in the lobby guests can use to check email or look up something on the web. The hotel also had a "Music Lounge" and a "Reading Lounge" but didn't get a chance to check out either.
reviews.title: Decent Hotel at an Excellent Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel was very close to Palacio National and walking towards Puerta del Sol, there were plenty of decent and cheap food options. Location was a 2min walk to the "Opera" metro stop. Since part of Line 2 (red line) was closed at the time we often walked to the "Sol" metro stop to catch Line 1 (blue line) for the museums. The walk to the "Sol" metro was not very far maybe a 10min walk at most.
reviews.title: Not as good as advertised

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: One complaint I had is the bathroom. The sliding glass door was not a big deal, but the entire floor would get wet every time we took a shower (no tub). It got so bad that the small towel you put down the floor is soaked and won't soak up anymore water; leaving the floor completely wet.
reviews.title: Trendy design hotel with friendly service
Good value for money
reviews.text: I have stayed here twice this year. Once for leisure and once for business. I really like the hotel. The location, breakfast (which is included) and service is superbe! Cool design.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: But the internett conncetion is too slow and unstable... which is a minus when you are on business :-(
reviews.title: Enjoyed the hotel.
The fabulous Mario
reviews.text: Otherwise nothing to say!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled with friends
reviews.text: Great Location. Nice Breakfast. Room was very nice.
reviews.title: Very Happy

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Internet in the room was free, which is rare in Europe.
reviews.title: I am tempted to lie about Mario

likes.disliked: — I would have liked tea/coffee-making facilities in the room. And it would be nice to have more than one computer for internet access.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled solo
reviews.text: I stayed at Room Mate Mario Sept. 23-28, 2007. This is a gem of a hotel! I had a small, quiet single in the back with a large , separate bathroom. The room was lovely, with beautiful white bedclothes, huge white towels, and navy blue carpet and accents. The room and hotel are pristine--real modern like a Vogue or W boutique hotel. the breakfast is great and it doesn't end till 12:30 PM, which is good if you're still on some other time.
reviews.title: RoomMate Mario is a winner!

likes.liked: — Chic rooms, convenient and elegant location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's less than two blocks from the Palacio Real and the fabulous gardens there and the national theater. It was easy getting from the airport to the hotel on the subway. But going back, I found a route from the Opera station using the Red, Purple and Pink lines because they feature escalators and there's less walking up and down stairs during transfers.
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is on a safe, elegant sidestreet that has a used and new bookshop (which features lots of popular paperback in English, probably left by American tourists), a Spanish deli, and a couple of other stores. Around the corner is a well-populated square, with the Opera subway stop right there! Just down the Arenal pedestrian walk (with a zillion stores and restaurants) is the Puerta del Sol subway station and all the activity, department stores, (and., groan..... McD's, KFC, Burger King, Starbucks and all that)...but with plenty of great, inexpensive Spanish restaurants, too.
reviews.title: Great Stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff at Mario (give Christiano a holler when you go!) is extremely helpful and friendly.
reviews.title: Love Mario

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only downer (slight) was that the American dollar was so low against the Euro when I visited (worth 61 cents!) that my 5 nites ended up costing $950 US, which at almost $200 a nite is no bargain. I would stay at Mario againa and again....despite the unfortunate"Room Mate" name, which sounds like some kind of youth hostel.
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great location

likes.liked: — The location, cleanliness, helpful staff and internet access.
likes.disliked: — The bathroom was a little cramped
